meanings.definition: Not enjoying or seeking the company of others.
meanings.sent1: She is quite unsocial and prefers to spend time alone.
meanings.sent2: The cat's unsocial behavior made it difficult to approach.
meanings.sent3: The unsocial squirrel refused to share its nuts with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His unsocial attitude created a barrier between him and his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The unsocial teenager always sat alone at lunch, lost in thought.

meanings.definition: Not conducive to friendly social relations.
meanings.sent1: The gloomy weather created an unsocial atmosphere at the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The unsocial environment of the office made it hard to connect with coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The unsocial park bench seemed to repel anyone who tried to sit on it.
meanings.sent4: The unsocial lighting in the room cast a cold and unwelcoming glow.
meanings.sent5: The unsocial party had guests leaving early, feeling uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Not sociable or outgoing in nature.
meanings.sent1: His unsocial personality made it challenging to make new friends.
meanings.sent2: The unsocial cat hid under the bed whenever guests came over.
meanings.sent3: The unsocial flower in the garden seemed to shy away from the sun.
meanings.sent4: The unsocial clouds blocked the warm rays of the sun, keeping the day cool.
meanings.sent5: The unsocial child preferred playing alone rather than with others.
